content: There is about a week left until the beta branch, and we need to merge https://github.com/rust-lang/rls/pull/1764 to fix RLS before then. Is anyone around here that has permissions on the RLS repo available to review/merge? The changes seem good to me.
Igor was the only one I know of, unless Manish still has super powers to dev tools repos
I've gone ahead and added the dev-tools team to the rls repo, so y'all should be able to merge now
(I can also directly merge, but this feels cleaner).

ok, I went ahead and merged it.

However, I don't want to be responsible for keeping rls running. If there is nobody available to do so, I think we should discuss sunsetting RLS.
It's the intent (we even have an accepted RFC) to do so in favor of rust-analyzer, which is moving slowly but surely along
doing so earlier may be possible too, not sure.

Eric Huss said:

ok, I went ahead and merged it.

However, I don't want to be responsible for keeping rls running. If there is nobody available to do so, I think we should discuss sunsetting RLS.

i don't mind pitching in a bit with low overhead stuff it helps, but i'd say i'm generally of the same mindset. e.g. even though things like https://github.com/rust-lang/rls/pull/1740 are easy and straightforward i wouldn't want to volunteer to deal with things like that either.

i figure the max of what would be in scope would be absolute blockers, which should probably at a minimum be distributed across more than one person

simulacrum said:

It's the intent (we even have an accepted RFC) to do so in favor of rust-analyzer, which is moving slowly but surely along

https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/issues/4224#issuecomment-929008874 and https://github.com/rust-lang/vscode-rust/issues/812 are still the right tracking issues for the cutover right?
uh, maybe? those look like the technical tracking issues, at least.
i feel like i've seen a few different threads on the topic but can't ever seem to come away convinced i've seen the right ones haha

Caleb Cartwright said:

simulacrum said:

It's the intent (we even have an accepted RFC) to do so in favor of rust-analyzer, which is moving slowly but surely along

https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/issues/4224#issuecomment-929008874 and https://github.com/rust-lang/vscode-rust/issues/812 are still the right tracking issues for the cutover right?

I don't think we have issues tracking the non-technical work. I've (and some other members of core) been engaging with rust-analyzer folks (primarily @matklad) on getting rust-analyzer in position to be officially adopted. We're very close, and I think once that happens, we can have more clear discussions on how to sunset rls
